description: Rada Miskovic leaks footage of ethical debates within the Council, drawing public attention to questionable BCI practices.
Public protests erupt, fueled by the leaked footage, igniting debates about privacy and ethical governance in Stenograd.
The Council holds an emergency meeting as public pressure increases, with the Harmonists advocating for immediate system stabilization.
The Harmonists temporarily halt any planned expansions of the BCI while they work to address public concerns and stabilize current operations.
BCI systems gradually show signs of improved synchronization, leading to a decrease in delays, which somewhat appeases the public.
A public symposium on the ethics of technological surveillance in governance is held, fostering debate on the future of the BCI system.
Discussions within the Council focus on strategies for maintaining Harmonists' influence while balancing public demands for transparency and accountability.
